caption.p: Mechanisms regarding antiviral activities of DMARDs and immunosuppressants.

tr.td: SARS-CoV, HIV, dengue virus, chikungunya virus, influenza A virus, HCV, Zika virus
(1) Increase endosomal pH required for virus/cell fusion (2) Interfere with the glycosylation of cellular receptors
Inhibit cyclophilins to incorporate into new virion, which is essential for virus infectivity
Inhibit host cyclophilins to form replication complex with NS5A/B of HCV, and influence protein folding and trafficking
Flavivirus (Zika virus, dengue virus, West Nile virus, yellow fever virus)
Block the interaction between host cyclophilins and flaviviral NS5 protein
Interrupt life cycle from: (1) viral protein synthesis (2) gag and envelope assembly (3) particle budding

(1) Inhibit DNA synthesis, slowing production of viral DNA (2) Deplete dNTP pools, which increase competitive ability of NRTIs to incorporate into HIV-1 DNA chain (3) Enhance NRTI phosphorylation, reducing resistance to NRTIs (4) Reduce cellular division of CD4+ T lymphocytes
(1) High affinity to HIV integrase and interaction with HIV integrase suppress the virus (2) Decrease viral expression from CD4+ T cells
Inhibit microglial activation and neuronal apoptosis
Reduce viral RNA synthesis, intracellular envelope protein expression, and the production of infectious virions
(1) Reduce RSV-mediated cytopathic effects (2) Prevent RSV infection by affecting RSV F protein production or maturation
Reduce cytopathic effects and viral protein expressions
Reduce CD3+ cells may impair the host to control disease
Inhibit the dividing CD4+ T cells, and hence cytostatic and antiviral effect by depletion of this substrate
Inhibit viral mRNA and protein expression via inhibition of cellular IMPDH
HSV, HIV, molluscum and verruca, CMV, BKV, RSV
Inhibit nucleocapsid tegumentation and thus prevents virion assembling
HTLV-1-induced ATLL is associated with JAK3 mutations; tofacitinib inhibits JAK3
Unknown, suspect anti-angiogenesis and make immune system able to trigger antiviral response
